{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is about a child with fever and sore throat who developed acute cervical lymphadenopathy. This suggests an inflammatory response in the neck area. Acute cervical lymphadenopathy can be caused by various factors including infections. Considering the symptoms, a common cause of such lymphadenopathy could be tonsillitis or pharyngitis. To investigate this further, a complete blood count (CBC) would be useful to rule out any underlying infection or inflammation. Therefore, option D: Complete hemogram is the most likely investigation to be done.", "answer_choice": "D"}
